<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Class for arbitrary precision integers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// APInt is a functional replacement for common case unsigned integer type like</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &quot;unsigned&quot;, &quot;unsigned long&quot; or &quot;uint64&#95;t&quot;, but also allows non-byte-width</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// integer sizes and large integer value types such as 3-bits, 15-bits, or more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// than 64-bits of precision. APInt provides a variety of arithmetic operators</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and methods to manipulate integer values of any bit-width. It supports both</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the typical integer arithmetic and comparison operations as well as bitwise</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// manipulation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The class has several invariants worth noting:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#42; All bit, byte, and word positions are zero-based.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#42; Once the bit width is set, it doesn&#39;t change except by the Truncate,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     SignExtend, or ZeroExtend operations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#42; All binary operators must be on APInt instances of the same bit width.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Attempting to use these operators on instances with different bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     widths will yield an assertion.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#42; The value is stored canonically as an unsigned value. For operations</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     where it makes a difference, there are both signed and unsigned variants</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     of the operation. For example, sdiv and udiv. However, because the bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     widths must be the same, operations such as Mul and Add produce the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     results regardless of whether the values are interpreted as signed or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     not.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#42; In general, the class tries to follow the style of computation that LLVM</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     uses in its IR. This simplifies its use for LLVM.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   &#42; APInt supports zero-bit-width values, but operations that require bits</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     are not defined on it (e.g. you cannot ask for the sign of a zero-bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     integer).  This means that operations like zero extension and logical</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     shifts are defined, but sign extension and ashr is not.  Zero bit values</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     compare and hash equal to themselves, and countLeadingZeros returns 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#91;&#91;nodiscard&#93;&#93; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a44d65323d90a63e5f572fe8f44db1154">APInt</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#aaf70a90533b469062634730e27f6577d"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">constexpr</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#aaf70a90533b469062634730e27f6577d">APINT&#95;BITS&#95;PER&#95;WORD</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a507f18d22ad9ce4dd96e8a664d577bdd">APINT&#95;WORD&#95;SIZE</a> &#42; CHAR&#95;BIT;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Create a new APInt of numBits width, initialized as val.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If isSigned is true then val is treated as if it were a signed value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// (i.e. as an int64&#95;t) and the appropriate sign extension to the bit width</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// will be done. Otherwise, no sign extension occurs (high order bits beyond</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the range of val are zero filled).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param numBits the bit width of the constructed APInt</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param val the initial value of the APInt</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param isSigned how to treat signedness of val</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param implicitTrunc allow implicit truncation of non-zero/sign bits of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                      val beyond the range of numBits</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a44d65323d90a63e5f572fe8f44db1154"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a44d65323d90a63e5f572fe8f44db1154">APInt</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> numBits, uint64&#95;t val, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/expandlargedivrem-cpp/#a49b2092a066cfbc24bc6925bdea9682a">isSigned</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Concatenate the bits from &quot;NewLSB&quot; onto the bottom of &#42;this.  This is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// equivalent to:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a6bc2ad05ce14ae805c176fc8abfbe0a1"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a44d65323d90a63e5f572fe8f44db1154">APInt</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a6bc2ad05ce14ae805c176fc8abfbe0a1">concat</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a44d65323d90a63e5f572fe8f44db1154">APInt</a> &amp;NewLSB)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// If the result will be small, then both the merged values are small.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NewWidth = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/valuetracking-cpp/#a2cb59ea8f9e8543986d40c48acfd24a3">getBitWidth</a>() + NewLSB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a512fe2c15ea651294688eeec1341644c">getBitWidth</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NewWidth &lt;= <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#aaf70a90533b469062634730e27f6577d">APINT&#95;BITS&#95;PER&#95;WORD</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a44d65323d90a63e5f572fe8f44db1154">APInt</a>(NewWidth, (U.VAL &lt;&lt; NewLSB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a512fe2c15ea651294688eeec1341644c">getBitWidth</a>()) | NewLSB.U.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#ab82287ee9a2442bc0b6025a9936c88dc">VAL</a>);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00992" /><CodeLine lineNumber="992"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Dual division/remainder interface.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00993" /><CodeLine lineNumber="993"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00994" /><CodeLine lineNumber="994"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Sometimes it is convenient to divide two APInt values and obtain both the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00995" /><CodeLine lineNumber="995"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// quotient and remainder. This function does both operations in the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00996" /><CodeLine lineNumber="996"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// computation making it a little more efficient. The pair of input arguments</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00997" /><CodeLine lineNumber="997"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// may overlap with the pair of output arguments. It is safe to call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00998" /><CodeLine lineNumber="998"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// udivrem(X, Y, X, Y), for example.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1695"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Converts APInt bits to a double</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1696"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1697"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The conversion does not do a translation from integer to double, it just</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1698"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// re-interprets the bits as a double. Note that it is valid to do this on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1699"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// any bit width. Exactly 64 bits will be translated.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1701"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1754"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1786"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// These building block operations operate on a representation of arbitrary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1787"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// precision, two&#39;s-complement, bignum integer values. They should be</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1837"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DST += SRC &#42; MULTIPLIER + PART   if add is true</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1838"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DST  = SRC &#42; MULTIPLIER + PART   if add is false</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1839"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1840"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Requires 0 &lt;= DSTPARTS &lt;= SRCPARTS + 1  If DST overlaps SRC they must</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1841"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// start at the same point, i.e. DST == SRC.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1842"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1843"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If DSTPARTS == SRC&#95;PARTS + 1 no overflow occurs and zero is returned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1844"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Otherwise DST is filled with the least significant DSTPARTS parts of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1845"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// result, and if all of the omitted higher parts were zero return zero,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1846"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// otherwise overflow occurred and return one.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1847"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> tcMultiplyPart(WordType &#42;dst, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> WordType &#42;src,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1849"><span class="doxyHighlight">                            </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> srcParts, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> dstParts, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> add);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1941"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\returns a uint64&#95;t with only bit at &quot;whichBit(bitPosition)&quot; set</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1942"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This method generates and returns a uint64&#95;t (word) mask for a single</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1943"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// bit at a specific bit position. This is used to mask the bit in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1944"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// corresponding word.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1945"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> uint64&#95;t maskBit(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> bitPosition) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1946"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> 1ULL &lt;&lt; whichBit(bitPosition);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1947"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1948"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1949"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Clear unused high order bits</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1950"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1951"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This method is used internally to clear the top &quot;N&quot; bits in the high order</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1952"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// word that are not used by the APInt. This is needed after the most</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1953"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// significant word is assigned a value to ensure that those bits are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1954"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// zero&#39;d out.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1955"><span class="doxyHighlight">  APInt &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/siisellowering-cpp/#aebab5179ce7e05015dcccd98da3c0ac5">clearUnusedBits</a>() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1956"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Compute how many bits are used in the final word.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1957"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> WordBits = ((<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmintrrange-cpp/#a0fb006a4e15d9908148dec45aed1f655">BitWidth</a> - 1) % APINT&#95;BITS&#95;PER&#95;WORD) + 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1958"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1959"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Mask out the high bits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1960"><span class="doxyHighlight">    uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/shuffles/#a6abf8a645bd24dfb42085db9672ac39a">mask</a> = WORDTYPE&#95;MAX &gt;&gt; (APINT&#95;BITS&#95;PER&#95;WORD - WordBits);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1961"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a104cae72182bec0ab951e3faea6ce509">LLVM&#95;UNLIKELY</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvvmintrrange-cpp/#a0fb006a4e15d9908148dec45aed1f655">BitWidth</a> == 0))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1962"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/shuffles/#a6abf8a645bd24dfb42085db9672ac39a">mask</a> = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1963"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1964"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (isSingleWord())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1965"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea4c614360da93c0a041b22e537de151eb">U</a>.VAL &amp;= <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/shuffles/#a6abf8a645bd24dfb42085db9672ac39a">mask</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1966"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1967"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea4c614360da93c0a041b22e537de151eb">U</a>.pVal&#91;getNumWords() - 1&#93; &amp;= <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/shuffles/#a6abf8a645bd24dfb42085db9672ac39a">mask</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1968"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">this</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1969"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1970"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1971"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Get the word corresponding to a bit position</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1974"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> isSingleWord() ? <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea4c614360da93c0a041b22e537de151eb">U</a>.VAL : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea4c614360da93c0a041b22e537de151eb">U</a>.pVal&#91;whichWord(bitPosition)&#93;;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2316"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Return A unsign-divided by B, rounded by the given rounding mode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2317"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> RoundingUDiv(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a3a0519ef55bfe3d07f8fb2eafb5cdbbd">APInt::Rounding</a> RM);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2320"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> RoundingSDiv(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a3a0519ef55bfe3d07f8fb2eafb5cdbbd">APInt::Rounding</a> RM);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2321"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2322"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Let q(n) = An^2 + Bn + C, and BW = bit width of the value range</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2323"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (e.g. 32 for i32).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2324"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This function finds the smallest number n, such that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2325"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (a) n &gt;= 0 and q(n) = 0, or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2326"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (b) n &gt;= 1 and q(n-1) and q(n), when evaluated in the set of all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2327"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     integers, belong to two different intervals &#91;Rk, Rk+R),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2328"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     where R = 2^BW, and k is an integer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The idea here is to find when q(n) &quot;overflows&quot; 2^BW, while at the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2330"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// same time &quot;allowing&quot; subtraction. In unsigned modulo arithmetic a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2331"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// subtraction (treated as addition of negated numbers) would always</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2332"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// count as an overflow, but here we want to allow values to decrease</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2333"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and increase as long as they are within the same interval.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2334"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Specifically, adding of two negative numbers should not cause an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2335"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// overflow (as long as the magnitude does not exceed the bit width).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2336"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// On the other hand, given a positive number, adding a negative</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2337"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// number to it can give a negative result, which would cause the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2338"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// value to go from &#91;-2^BW, 0) to &#91;0, 2^BW). In that sense, zero is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2339"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// treated as a special case of an overflow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2340"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2341"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This function returns std::nullopt if after finding k that minimizes the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2342"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// positive solution to q(n) = kR, both solutions are contained between</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2343"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// two consecutive integers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2344"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2345"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// There are cases where q(n) &gt; T, and q(n+1) &lt; T (assuming evaluation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2346"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in arithmetic modulo 2^BW, and treating the values as signed) by the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2347"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// virtue of &#42;signed&#42; overflow. This function will &#42;not&#42; find such an n,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2348"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// however it may find a value of n satisfying the inequalities due to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2349"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// an &#42;unsigned&#42; overflow (if the values are treated as unsigned).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2350"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// To find a solution for a signed overflow, treat it as a problem of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2351"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// finding an unsigned overflow with a range with of BW-1.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2352"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2353"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The returned value may have a different bit width from the input</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2354"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// coefficients.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2355"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::optional&lt;APInt&gt; SolveQuadraticEquationWrap(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2356"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RangeWidth);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2357"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2358"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Compare two values, and if they are different, return the position of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2359"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// most significant bit that is different in the values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2360"><span class="doxyHighlight">std::optional&lt;unsigned&gt; GetMostSignificantDifferentBit(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2362"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2363"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Splat/Merge neighboring bits to widen/narrow the bitmask represented</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2364"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// by \\param A to \\param NewBitWidth bits.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2365"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2366"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// MatchAnyBits: (Default)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2367"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// e.g. ScaleBitMask(0b0101, 8) -&gt; 0b00110011</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2368"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// e.g. ScaleBitMask(0b00011011, 4) -&gt; 0b0111</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2369"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
